modules.description: This module handles the display of OCaml toplevel output values and structures by providing functions to format and print outcomes such as values, types, module types, and signatures. It works directly with `Outcometree` types like `out_value`, `out_type`, and `out_sig_item`, using formatters to render them in a human-readable way. It is used to customize and control the output of the OCaml toplevel loop, particularly for printing evaluation results and type information during interactive sessions.

This module handles error manipulation and exception handling during parsing tasks. It provides functions to transform values while propagating exceptions, extract exception messages, and catch specific parsing errors from external libraries. Concrete use cases include handling lexical and syntax errors during source code processing and ensuring robust error propagation in parsing pipelines.

This module manages the OCaml toplevel output formatting and syntax initialization, providing functions to customize how values, types, and signatures are displayed. It operates on `Outcometree` types and `Longident.t`, using formatters to render output during interactive sessions. Concrete use cases include modifying operator display via `lident_operator_map`, initializing Reason or OCaml syntax modes, and toggling between syntax styles at runtime.

This module handles parsing and evaluation of ReasonML code in a REPL environment. It provides functions to parse ReasonML syntax into OCaml AST structures and execute top-level phrases. Concrete use cases include integrating ReasonML scripting into applications and building interactive development tools.
